Bases: object

Peform crossover between pairs in a population

Parameters:population – 2darray of solutions to perform crossover on.
Returns:a new population with generated from the old one.
Return type:ndarray
class tspsolver.ga.crossover.OnePointPMX(pcross=0.6, use_rog=False)[source]¶

Bases: tspsolver.ga.crossover.AbstractCrossoverOperator

Create a new population using one point PMX crossover. The pivot location of the split is determined uniformly at random.

class tspsolver.ga.crossover.OrderCrossover(pcross=0.6, use_rog=False)[source]¶

Bases: tspsolver.ga.crossover.AbstractCrossoverOperator

Create a new population by keeping a subtour of the chromosome and then copying from the other parent.

Bases: tspsolver.ga.crossover.AbstractCrossoverOperator

Create a new population using one point PMX crossover. The pivot location of the split is determined uniformly at random.

class tspsolver.ga.mutation.DisplacementMutation(pmutate=0.5)[source]¶

Bases: tspsolver.ga.mutation.AbstractMutationOperator

Mutate indivudals in a population by randomly moving a subtour in the chromosome.

class tspsolver.ga.mutation.InsertionMutation(pmutate=0.5)[source]¶

Bases: tspsolver.ga.mutation.AbstractMutationOperator

Mutate indivduals in a population by randomly removing and reinserting a gene in a different part of the chromosome.

class tspsolver.ga.mutation.InversionMutation(pmutate=0.5)[source]¶

Bases: tspsolver.ga.mutation.AbstractMutationOperator

Mutate indivudals in a population by randomly moving a subtour in the chromosome then reversing it.

class tspsolver.ga.mutation.SwapCityMutation(pmutate=0.5)[source]¶

Bases: tspsolver.ga.mutation.AbstractMutationOperator

Mutate indivudals in a population by randomly swapping two genes.

class tspsolver.ga.population_generation.SimplePopulationGenerator(population_size, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: tspsolver.ga.population_generation.AbstractPopulationGenerator

Generate a population based on randomly shuffling 1D array of the indicies of every data point. This makes no attempt to consider any heuristic.

generate(data)[source]¶

Generate a new random population of the given size.

selection(population, distance_matrix)[source]¶

Choose a subset of a population to breed from.

Parameters:
  • population – 2D array representing the population of solutions.
  • distance_matrix – the distance matrix of points in the dataset
Returns:

a subset of the population which are the fittest
Return type:

ndarray
class tspsolver.ga.selection.RouletteWheelSelection(**kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: tspsolver.ga.selection.AbstractSelectionOperator

Roulette Wheel Selection

Implements fitness propotionate or “roulette wheel” selection. Individuals are selected with probability that is directly proportional to their fitness

load_component(name, params, module_name)[source]¶

Loads a sub component of the GA.

This method dynamically sets up an instance of a class defined by the parameters passed to the system.

Parameters:
  • name – the name of the type of component to load
  • params – the parameter dictionary defining the algorithm
  • module_name – the name of the python module to load from
Returns:

a new instance of the component with it’s paramters set
Return type:

Object
perform_crossover(population)[source]¶

Apply the crossover operator to a population

Parameters:population – the population to apply the operator too
perform_mutation(population)[source]¶

Apply the mutation operator to a population

Parameters:population – the population to apply the operator too
perform_selection(population, distance_matrix)[source]¶

Apply the selection operator to a population

Parameters:
  • population – the population to apply the operator too
  • distance_matrix – distance matrix for points in the dataset
score(X)[source]¶

Score function runs the genetic algorithm and returns the best fitness achieved.

This is useful in parameter tuning to evaluate the settings of the GA.

Parameters:X – the data to run the GA with
Returns:an integer representing the best fitness achieved by this GA
Return type:Int
set_params(**parameters)[source]¶

Set the parameters of the GA

This takes a flat dictionary of keyword arguments for each of the components of the GA. Parameters must be named according to the convention ‘<component>_<param name>’. E.g. ‘crossover_pcross’.

This format is require for integration with scikit-learn tools, such as the ParameterGrid function.

Parameters:parameters – dictionary of parameters for the GA.
